Features archive
  • April 14, 2015

    ICSSC presents Google-themed hackathon

    Google Web Hacks provided nearly 50 students with 24 hours to build any web application using Google technologies.

  • April 3, 2015

    Taking on the telecom industry

    Alumnus Bayan Towfiq, CEO of Flowroute Inc., discusses bootstrapping a successful startup with a team of ICS alumni.

  • March 6, 2015

    ICS grad students to present Racial Violence Archive at iConference

    Microsoft Research awarded the team of seven students $3,000 to present their collaborative class project at iConference 2015 in March.

  • February 26, 2015

    Informatics professor Joshua Tanenbaum brings the world’s largest game- creation event to UCI, producing seven games in 48 hours.

  • February 12, 2015

    Jed Brubaker’s graduate research guides Facebook’s new policy on postmortem account stewardship

    In Memoriam – Robert L. Newcomb

    UC Irvine Center for Statistical Consulting founding director and social sciences senior lecturer was a 45-year member of the UCI community

    Butterworth and Beall competitions reward the best in both hardware and software.

    In a historic event, President Barack Obama offered an unforgettable commencement address.

  • June 13, 2014

    The first year of the Undergraduate Mentorship Program focused on helping ICS women forge ties with industry professionals.

    UCI’s first 14 computer game science majors are set to graduate.

    UCI team takes second place in regional ACM competition, invited to finals in Russia next June

    Dean Hal Stern welcomes a record-setting class of new students as the 2013-14 academic year kicks off with nearly 800 new faces.

    Intel Science & Technology Center for Social Computing welcomes an interdisciplinary class of fellows.

  • October 25, 2013

    To be or not to be

    Ph.D. candidate Jed Brubaker studies the postmortem persistence of digital identity.

  • August 27, 2013

    Class of 2013

    The Bren School conferred 333 degrees during the 2012-13 academic year. Congratulations, graduates!

  • August 22, 2013

    Gifted guide

    UCI Emeriti Association recognizes Bren Professor Judith Olson with a 2013 Outstanding Mentor Award.

  • August 16, 2013

    Butterworth Product Development Competition 2013

    Creators of Bluetooth Assisted Tracking, or BAT, win the 2013 Butterworth Product Development Competition, a contest that promotes the creation of commercially viable technology while fostering entrepreneurship among students.

  • August 7, 2013

    2013 Celebration of Teaching

    Ph.D. students Jed Brubaker and Eric Hennigan and associate professor Don Patterson honored for their outstanding contributions to undergraduate instruction.

  • August 7, 2013

    Global Google Fellows

    Ph.D. students Yingyi Bu and Bart Knijnenburg win fellowships recognizing the world’s “most promising young academics.”

  • July 11, 2013

    Fostering inclusivity

    Recent business information management graduate closes impressive UCI career with a 2013 Chancellor’s Award of Distinction.

  • June 19, 2013

    Anteater Award winner

    ICS Student Council recognized by the office of Student Life & Leadership for launching first-ever Med AppJam competition.

  • June 19, 2013

    Autism AppJam 2013

    UC Irvine students from various disciplines team up to create mobile applications that benefit persons with autism.

  • April 24, 2013

    A whole new class

    Association for Computing Machinery taps professor Gene Tsudik to spearhead major security classification overhaul.

  • April 17, 2013

    Focused on the big picture

    Bren Professor Ramesh Jain aims to integrate health data and make it globally available – by phone.

  • April 14, 2013

    They’re init(together)

    Student group launches conference to facilitate growth of vibrant female tech community in Southern California

  • March 13, 2013

    Cultivating collaboration

    Dean Stern unveils the Kay Family Foundation Innovation Lab, which features Apple TVs, a PolyVision smartboard, and MacBook Airs and iPads available for checkout by students.

  • January 17, 2013

    Gene genie

    Smartphone app developed by professor Gene Tsudik and fellow researchers permits secure storage and testing of DNA data.

  • January 16, 2013

    Building on a dream

    After starting a campus club to assist Kenya schools, computer science major Nithin Jilla now aims to improve access to education on a global scale.

  • December 7, 2012

    First-ever Med AppJam

    Students from UCI's Bren School and School of Medicine team up to create iOS-based applications useful to both physicians and patients.

  • November 5, 2012

    College prep via app design

    Coached by Bren School students, middle school teams learn STEM skills by creating educational smartphone games.

  • November 1, 2012

    2012 Eugene Cota-Robles Fellow Profile

    First-year Ph.D. student Kristin Roher received a Eugene-Cota Robles Fellowship, considered the most prestigious diversity fellowship offered at UC Irvine.

  • July 23, 2012

    Alumna joins Google.org

    Nithya Sambasivan (Ph.D. ’12), now a user experience researcher with the philanthropic division of Google, continues to study the role that digital technology plays in developing countries.

  • June 19, 2012

    Winter 2012 AppJam

    A team of UCI undergraduates took home the latest AppJam Tournament grand prize with “AwkTalk,” which provides users with instant feedback on their social skills.

  • June 13, 2012

    Scacchi receives Distinguished Alumnus Award

    Walt Scacchi (Ph.D. ’81), senior research scientist and research faculty at the Institute for Software Research and research director for the Center for Computer Games and Virtual Worlds, received the Bren School’s 2012 Distinguished Alumnus Award.

  • June 12, 2012

    Butterworth Product Development Competition 2012

    Ten teams of UCI students representing various disciplines — including computer science, business and the arts — competed for cash prizes totaling $10,000 in the final round of the 9th Annual Butterworth Product Development Competition.

  • May 7, 2012

    Email ‘vacations’ decrease stress

    Findings by professor Gloria Mark and scientist Stephen Voida could boost on-the-job productivity.

  • April 26, 2012

    Student Project Showcase 2012

    Dozens of undergraduates showed off their innovations at the annual Student Project Showcase, including iPad and Android apps, web portals, and a home automation system.

  • April 25, 2012

    Michael Franz wins prestigious IEEE Computer Society award

    The IEEE Computer Society is honoring Professor Michael Franz with a 2012 Technical Achievement Award.

  • April 23, 2012

    2012 NSF Fellows

    Bren School Ph.D. students Kevin Bache and Nicholas DiGiuseppe join 15 other UC Irvine students as 2012 National Science Foundation Graduate Research Fellows.

  • February 27, 2012

    Making IT more PC

    Values in design pioneer and new informatics professor Geoffrey Bowker advocates responsible technological innovation.

  • February 24, 2012

    Game Jam Winter 2012: Creating games from scratch in 7 days

    Five groups, each with about 15 students, participated in the latest Game Jam, organized by the Video Game Development Club. Competitors were given one week to design a fully functional video game that incorporates the theme of "growth."

  • January 10, 2012

    Students build mobile applications in a week

    A group of undergrads led by a master’s student won the inaugural AppJam with “TimeToGo,” a location-sensitive event reminder.

  • December 7, 2011

    Datspace: New student club gets creative

    With workshop topics ranging from Arduino hacking to espresso brewing, new student organization Design, Art, and Technology Hackerspace (DAT Space) is making good on its promise to provide a student-run physical space where members of the UCI community can meet and work together on creative projects.

  • November 28, 2011

    Statistically significant

    As new head of the UCI Center for Statistical Consulting, alumnus Vinh Nguyen aims to help researchers across campus and Orange County.

  • October 10, 2011

    Visualizing the future

    Associate professor Aditi Majumder's lab team develops better, simpler, cheaper display technologies.

  • September 21, 2011

    Welcome Week 2011

    Student leaders helped usher in 500+ new freshmen, transfers and graduate students to the Bren School during Welcome Week at UCI.

  • August 22, 2011

    Bioinformatics boosters

    IGB summer research program exposes community college students to emerging field.

  • August 5, 2011

    UCI Team Places Third in Microsoft’s Speller Challenge

    A group of Bren School students took third place in the Microsoft Speller Challenge, in which teams submitted programs designed to suggest plausible alternatives to misspellings in search queries. More than 100 teams submitted 435 programs, placing UCI in the top 1 percent of the competition.

  • August 4, 2011

    Graduate Student Wins NSF Fellowship

    Informatics graduate student Sen Hirano is one of 20 UCI students who received a prestigious 2011 National Science Foundation Graduate Research Fellowship.

  • May 18, 2011

    ICS Day offers R&R

    Student-organized festival features dunk tank, coding competition and video game demos.

  • April 11, 2011

    Rethinking 'reachability'

    Melissa Mazmanian, assistant professor of informatics, studies the role of wireless technology in users' work and personal lives.

  • February 7, 2011

    You say you want a revolution

    Researcher Ban Al-Ani tracks the role of social media in the Egyptian uprising.

  • November 29, 2010

    Playing by the numbers

    Dean Hal Stern, a statistician and sports lover, is known for his statistically based opposition to the BCS football rankings.

  • February 8, 2010

    Helping Haitians find family

    Chen Li, associate professor of computer science, and his students created a people-finder site to help quake victims reunite.
